items.title: The Guardian
items.subtitle: Visuals Intern
items.text: Covered the 2018 midterm elections for the Guardian's Visuals team, building election-related interactives, contributing to data analysis, and developing the backend and UI of the Guardian's live election results.

items.title: NBC
items.subtitle: Multimedia Journalism Intern
items.text: Worked in NBC's national newsroom in the Owned Stations division, producing videos, designing graphics, developing interactives, and building digital tools for NBC's 15 local station websites.

items.title: The Delta Center
items.subtitle: Media Intern
items.text: Assisted with the Delta Center’s “Most Southern Place on Earth” workshops by planning logistics, taking photos and video, producing multimedia stories, and designing printed marketing.

items.title: CustomInk
items.subtitle: Software Engineering Intern
items.text: Worked on the eCommerce technology team, entirely rebuilding an internal inventory management system with MySQL, MongoDB, Ruby on Rails, and JS.

items.title: "Facebook, the New Frontier of Political Ads"
items.subtitle: Writing, Interactive
items.text: An investigative story and interactive about the habits of political advertisers on Facebook that allowed readers to see what ads were targeted towards them.

items.title: "2020 New Hampshire Primary Candidate Tracker"
items.subtitle: Interactive, Data
items.text: An application that allows repoters at NBC to track 2020 presidential candidates visiting New Hampshire.

items.title: "Exploring Faceboook's News Landscape"
items.subtitle: Data Visualization
items.text: A data visualization to look at how people interact with posts from news pages on Facebook.

items.title: "Things Have Got to Change": Affordable Housing in Chapel Hill
items.subtitle: Writing
items.text: A profile of Yvette Matthews, an activist promoting affordable housing amidst soaring rents in Chapel Hill.

items.title: "Viewing World Trade through the Lens of History"
items.subtitle: Data Visualization
items.text: A data visualization exploring the patterns of imports/exports throughout history.

items.title: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
items.subtitle: B.A. Journalism, B.A. Computer Science
items.text: Double-majoring in journalism and CS, with a minor in entrepreneurship. Relevant coursework includes Interactive Journalism, Big Data Ethics, Data Structures, UX design, and Multimedia Storytelling. GPA: 3.91

items.title: Duke University
items.subtitle: Robertson Scholar
items.text: Accepted into a selective scholarship program to be a “dual citizen” of both UNC and Duke, studying and living at both schools. Coursework includes Algorithmic Journalism, Politics and Media, and Profile Writing.

items.title: Thomas Jefferson High School for Science and Technology
items.subtitle: Concentration: software engineering
items.text: Attended a selective magnet high school for science, technology, engineering and mathematics.

items.title: Duke DeWitt Wallace Center for Media and Democracy
items.subtitle: Online Gatekeeping
items.text: Collaborated with Dr. Phillip Napoli on research on the spread of news content on social media, which was selected for the Association of Internet Researchers conference and is pending publication.

items.title: Media and Journalism Emerging Technologies Lab
items.subtitle: AR Storytelling
items.text: Developed new storytelling technologies in Prof. Steven King's lab, including a photogrammetry tool and a scavenger hunt app. Responsibilities included product management, research, design, and development.
